---
title: Tutorials
---

Introductory tutorials to help you learn Tabulae.


::: {.callout-important}
All code examples in these tutorials use the Tabulae data set in the [`datasets/core-infl-shared` directory](https://github.com/neelsmith/Tabulae.jl/tree/main/datasets/core-infl-shared) of the Tabulae github repository.
:::

## Quickest start


```{julia}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| output: false
repo = pwd() |> dirname |> dirname
```


Build a Tabulae dataset from a directory of local files:

```{julia}
#| output: false
#| warning: false
using Tabulae, CitableParserBuilder
srcdir = joinpath(repo, "datasets", "core-infl-shared") 
tds = dataset([srcdir])

```


Compile a parser from the dataset, and parse Latin tokens:



```{julia}
#| warning: false
parser = stringParser(tds)
parses = parsetoken("animo", parser)
```

Label the results:

```{julia}
parses .|> latinForm .|> label
```

## Prerequisites

You’ll need to [install Julia](https://julialang.org/downloads/) before you can use Kanónes
